Moxys Mixology Manual was a book dedicated to the art of mixology and collecting numerous alcoholic drink recipes, penned sometime in or before the late 15 century DR.
The reader could consider Moxys to be a comprehensive guide to cocktails, despite its crass wording and the authors preference for the drinks made with gin-and-whiskey. The book also included recipes for vodka, vermouth, and rum and did not miss a chance to denigrate them as inferior. Lastly, the author recommended that readers never call themselves "mixologists," professional, or amateur instead preferring the term "bartender." Moxy clearly thought that calling oneself a mixologist made one sound like a "pillock."
In the , a copy of Moxys Mixology Manual could be found in the hands of the proprietors of The Singing Lute eatery in the city of Baldurs Gate.
